subject: Photography
title: Monochromatic Photography
description: A short lesson to help you apply Monochromatic Photography.

hook.text: One color, infinite possibilities. Monochromatic images use a single hue in varying shades and intensities.

buildup.text: Monochromatic doesn't mean black and white. It means using one hue ‚Äî like all blues, all greens, or all reds.

discovery.text: In monochrome, texture and light do the heavy lifting. Without color contrast, tonal variation creates depth.

twist.text: Fog, underwater, and night scenes are naturally monochromatic. The camera captures what's already a single palette.

climax.text: Monochromatic images feel focused, elegant, and emotionally unified. They simplify and amplify simultaneously.

punchline.text: One color, many moods. Simplicity is powerful.

quiz.question: What does monochromatic mean in photography?
options: Using variations of a single hue in different shades and intensities
